org.opends.server.extensions

Class DiskSpaceMonitor

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.opends.server.api.MonitorProvider<MonitorProviderCfg>
      • org.opends.server.extensions.DiskSpaceMonitor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class DiskSpaceMonitor
extends MonitorProvider<MonitorProviderCfg>
implements java.lang.Runnable
    This class provides an application-wide disk space monitoring service. It provides the ability for registered handlers to receive notifications when the free disk space falls below a certain threshold. The handler will only be notified once when when the free space have dropped below any of the thresholds. Once the "full" threshold have been reached, the handler will not be notified again until the free space raises above the "low" threshold.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DiskSpaceMonitor(java.lang.String instanceName, java.io.File directory, long lowThreshold, long fullThreshold, int interval, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit unit, DiskSpaceMonitorHandler handler)
      Constructs a new DiskSpaceMonitor that will notify the specified DiskSpaceMonitorHandler when the specified disk falls below the provided thresholds.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DiskSpaceMonitor

        public DiskSpaceMonitor(java.lang.String instanceName,
                java.io.File directory,
                long lowThreshold,
                long fullThreshold,
                int interval,
                java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit unit,
                DiskSpaceMonitorHandler handler)
        Constructs a new DiskSpaceMonitor that will notify the specified DiskSpaceMonitorHandler when the specified disk falls below the provided thresholds.
        Parameters:
        instanceName - A unique name for this monitor.
        directory - The directory to monitor.
        lowThreshold - The "low" threshold.
        fullThreshold - The "full" threshold.
        interval - The polling interval for checking free space.
        unit - the time unit of the interval parameter.
        handler - The handler to get notified when the provided thresholds are reached or null if no notification is needed;
